intro: Randia curvata, commonly known as the curly randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves that are often hairy. Randia curvata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks.
